title: How to Make Chocolate and Banana Muffins

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 320 degrees F, 160 degrees C, or on gas mark 2.
Mix all the dry ingredients together.
steps.description: Combine in a bowl the flour, the brown sugar, the chocolate chips, the cocoa powder, the baking soda, and the baking powder. Mix thoroughly with a spoon to combine the ingredients as much as possible before beginning the next step.

steps.headline: Add the wet ingredients to the dry.
steps.description: Combine the vanilla, butter, egg, banana, and crème fraiche to the bowl with the dry ingredients. Stir it with a spoon, just enough to mix everything evenly.

steps.headline: Bake.
steps.description: Put some batter into each of the muffin moulds using the spoon. Only fill them to about 2/3 of their capacity since the batter will rise while baking. Place the muffins onto a baking tray and put them into the oven. Allow to bake for about 25-30 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Once the muffins are done, take them out of the oven and let them cool a little before removing them from the moulds. Place them on a serving tray.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: If you like, you can sprinkle the muffins with a little icing sugar. They taste best if you eat them while still warm. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Place the flours into a mixing bowl.
Add the bananas, pineapple, cashews, baking powder and baking soda.
Add the vanilla and chocolate powder.
steps.description: Mix in quickly. It should now be a thick batter.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into muffin pan holes.
steps.description: Fill to about three quarters of the height.

steps.headline: Place into the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 10 to 15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.

text: Chocolate and Banana Muffins Preheat the oven to 320 degrees F, 160 degrees C, or on gas mark 2.  Mix all the dry ingredients together. Combine in a bowl the flour, the brown sugar, the chocolate chips, the cocoa powder, the baking soda, and the baking powder. Mix thoroughly with a spoon to combine the ingredients as much as possible before beginning the next step. Add the wet ingredients to the dry. Combine the vanilla, butter, egg, banana, and crème fraiche to the bowl with the dry ingredients. Stir it with a spoon, just enough to mix everything evenly. Bake. Put some batter into each of the muffin moulds using the spoon. Only fill them to about 2/3 of their capacity since the batter will rise while baking. Place the muffins onto a baking tray and put them into the oven. Allow to bake for about 25-30 minutes. Remove from the oven. Once the muffins are done, take them out of the oven and let them cool a little before removing them from the moulds. Place them on a serving tray. Serve. If you like, you can sprinkle the muffins with a little icing sugar. They taste best if you eat them while still warm. Enjoy! Finished.  Chocolate Pineapple Banana Muffins Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.  Place the flours into a mixing bowl.  Add the bananas, pineapple, cashews, baking powder and baking soda. Mix together well. Add the vanilla and chocolate powder. Mix in quickly. It should now be a thick batter. Pour the batter into muffin pan holes. Fill to about three quarters of the height. Place into the preheated oven. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Serve warm. Absolutely delicious!
